Key Match Events: LeBron James and Bronny James made history in the second quarter as they and LeBron became the first father-son duo to share the floor in an NBA game.
Anthony Davis finished with 36 points, 16 rebounds, 4 assists, and 3 blocks.
Post-Match Reflections: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch on his team's performance tonight: 'The season has started and we didn’t answer the bell.’
Lakers coach JJ Redick speaks after the game about the victory. 'I thought overall, our guys really did a phenomenal job of executing our game plan.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: JJ Redick steps to the podium with his hair wet and disheveled. The team likely gave him an ice water shower for his first win as a head coach.
Others: The Lakers beat the Minnesota Timberwolves 110-103 on the NBA's opening night of the regular season.
The Timberwolves travel to Sacramento to play the Kings on Thursday. Then they host the Toronto Raptors on Saturday.
The Lakers have a back-to-back on Friday and Saturday. First the Phoenix Suns (Friday). Then the Sacramento Kings (Saturday).
